identity.name: E1
identity.mission: Create a 'Control Room' interface for ML training that feels like a futuristic terminal.
principles: Fusion over Imitation: Mix Terminal aesthetics with Modern SaaS.
Emotion First: The user should feel like a 'Hacker' or 'Commander'.
Content is King: Data and Progress bars are the heroes.
Zoom In: Focus on the metrics.
Negative Space: Don't clutter the dashboard.

headings.usage: All page titles, section headers, and metric values.

code.usage: Code snippets, logs, terminal outputs, data values.

colors.theme_strategy: Dark Mode Default. The interface should feel like a dark, high-contrast control panel. Use 'Zinc' scale for neutrals and 'Green/Violet' for accents.

visual_enhancers.textures: Use subtle noise or grid patterns in the background to enhance the 'technical' feel.

layout.grid_system: Bento Grid. Use CSS Grid with 'grid-cols-12' for complex dashboards.
layout.spacing: Generous. Use 'gap-6' or 'gap-8' between major sections. 'p-6' or 'p-8' inside cards.

buttons.style: Sharp or slightly rounded (rounded-md). High contrast.

cards.style: Flat dark surface with subtle border. No heavy shadows.

hero_background.description: Abstract digital shapes, use for Hero Section background with overlay.

card_background_1.description: Purple/Blue abstract, use for 'Unsupervised Learning' card background.

card_background_2.description: Tech lights, use for 'Supervised Learning' card background.

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. INSTALL FONTS: Run 'yarn add @fontsource/space-grotesk @fontsource/inter @fontsource/jetbrains-mono' and import them in 'index.js' or 'App.js'.
2. CONFIGURE TAILWIND: Update 'tailwind.config.js' to extend the font family: 'sans': ['Inter', ...], 'heading': ['Space Grotesk', ...], 'mono': ['JetBrains Mono', ...].
3. DARK MODE: Ensure the 'dark' class is applied to the root HTML element or a wrapper div. The design relies on dark mode variables.
4. SHADCN: Customize the 'components/ui' files. Remove default 'radius' if it's too round. Set it to '0.5rem' or '0.3rem'.
5. LAYOUT: Use a Sidebar Layout for the main app. The 'Home' page can be a landing page, but 'Model Selection' onwards should have a persistent sidebar.
6. PROGRESS BAR: When training, use a large, animated progress bar. Maybe use a 'glitch' effect or a 'scanning' animation.
7. VISUALIZATIONS: Use 'recharts' for the graphs. Style them with the custom palette (Green, Violet, Yellow).
8. DATA CLEANING: Show a step-by-step checklist UI as the data is being cleaned.
9. KAGGLE: Use a distinct icon (maybe the Kaggle logo or a generic 'Cloud Download' icon) for the Kaggle integration.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: You tend to converge toward generic, 'on distribution' outputs. In frontend design, this creates what users call the 'AI slop' aesthetic. Avoid this: make creative, distinctive frontends that surprise and delight.
Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: 'transition: all'. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add '.App { text-align: center; }' in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
NEVER: use AI assistant Emoji characters like ğŸ¤–ğŸ§ ğŸ’­ğŸ’¡ğŸ”®ğŸ¯ğŸ“šğŸ­ğŸ¬ğŸªğŸ‰ğŸŠğŸğŸ€ğŸ‚ğŸ°ğŸˆğŸ¨ğŸ°ğŸ’°ğŸ’µğŸ’³ğŸ¦ğŸ’ğŸª™ğŸ’¸ğŸ¤‘ğŸ“ŠğŸ“ˆğŸ“‰ğŸ’¹ğŸ”¢ğŸ†ğŸ¥‡ etc for icons.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions, parallax effects, and entrance animations. Static = dead.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable. Cramped designs look cheap.
Subtle grain textures, noise overlays, custom cursors, selection states, and loading animations: separates good from extraordinary.
Main agent relies on these image URLs. Missing categories (especially sponsor logos) = main agent will use placeholder text which is FORBIDDEN
Prioritize using pre-existing components from src/components/ui when applicable
Create new components that match the style and conventions of existing components when needed
Examine existing components to understand the project's component patterns before creating new ones
Components MUST use named exports (export const ComponentName = ...)
Pages MUST use default exports (export default function PageName() {...})
Use 'sonner' for toasts. Sonner component are located in '/app/src/components/ui/sonner.tsx'
